name: Typeproviderlib
body:
### Type Provider library for 101explorer
This library provides types that can be used to access 101explorer. E.g. for accessing a specific file:

```fsharp
 let url = "http://101companies.org/resources/contributions/javaStatic/src/test/java/org/softlang/company/tests/CutTest.java"
    let target = OneOhOne.File(url)

    printfn "%s" target.classifier
    printfn "%s" target.language
    target.derived |> Seq.iter( fun derived ->
        printfn "%s" derived.name
    )
```

### How does it work
The types are dynamically generated based on the JSON schemas that can also be found on the [101worker repository](https://github.com/101companies/101worker/tree/master/schemas). The actual data is delivered by 101explorer.

So, for example the [file schema](https://github.com/101companies/101worker/blob/master/schemas/101repo_file.json):

```javascript
        "classifier": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "classifier of this entity"
        },
        "geshi": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "geshi code that can be used for highlighting"
        },
        "derived": {
            "type": "array",
            "description": "array of all derived files",
            "items": {
```

will get transformed to a normal F# type with full IDE support:

![typeproviderscreenshot](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1643263/1016713/7c7a3ce0-0c00-11e3-8467-cea3d02c7652.png)

### How well does it work
Well, its pretty fresh and I don't think I'll continue it, but it was a decent excercise ;)

### Authors and Contributors
So far, @martinleinberger is the only developer.

### Support or Contact
There is no support :>
